meanings.sent1: She chagrined after forgetting her lines on stage.
meanings.sent2: He chagrined when he realized he had missed an important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat chagrined after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: His heart chagrined as he saw the disappointment in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The student's face chagrined as she received a failing grade.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel distressed or humiliated
meanings.sent1: The teacher chagrined the student by pointing out his mistake in front of the class.
meanings.sent2: His thoughtless comment chagrined his friend.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy chagrined its owner by chewing up the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The harsh criticism chagrined the young writer's confidence.
meanings.sent5: The news of the betrayal chagrined her deeply.
